name: Heels-elevated Goblet Squat
setup: Place small plates or heel wedges under heels (1-2 inches elevation)
Hold bell at chest (horns for KB or one end of DB), forearms vertical
Brace lightly and keep ribs stacked over pelvis
steps: Inhale, sit hips back slightly and bend knees to descend
Track knees over mid-foot; keep torso tall and elbows pointing down
Descend to full comfortable depth—elevation allows deeper squat
Exhale, drive through mid-foot/heels to stand tall
Finish with glutes squeezed softly, ribs down
cues: Elbows down; bell tight to chest
mistakes: Leaning too far forward with heel elevation
Overusing the ankle mobility and losing hip hinge
Heels coming off the plates during movement
safety: Heel elevation helps with ankle mobility limitations and allows deeper squat position. Ensure plates/wedges are stable and non-slip.

progressions: Remove heel elevation and work toward full goblet squat

prescriptionHints.load: KB 12–24 kg or DB 25–50 lb—similar to regular goblet squat
prescriptionHints.notes: Excellent for building ankle mobility and squat depth. Progress to flat-footed squats over time.

joints.notes: Ideal for limited ankle dorsiflexion. Heel elevation reduces calf flexibility demands while building squat strength.
